messages.message: (no rush — enjoy Sunday :blush:) Hey @Ashish and maybe other website folks, I’m getting some strange homepage-related behavior on instabase.com (http://instabase.com) when logged in. Is there a good place to file these kinds of bugs?

• If I go to http://instabase.com (default if I just type in “instabase.com (http://instabase.com)” in chrome), then I land on the wordpress homepage
• If I go to https://instabase.com, I land on the platform home screen
• If I to to http and then click “platform login,” I end up on the platform login page, still under http, so chrome warns me not to type my username and password in
Is this intentional? At a minimum, I think we should have the “platform login” link always go to https
@kunal as FYI as well. Know Ashish pushed out some web infra changes so could be impacted through that.

@Erick this is a great catch on both fronts
1. http://instabase.com and https://instabase.com behaviors should not diverge
2. The login page definitely should be https://. GCloud LB/Nginx is meant to do a redirect to https for all http traffic
I'll troubleshoot the login page.

These problems should ideally go away as we move to the new infrastructure. Both wordpress and product will be behind Instabase nginx server in the new infra.
